newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Porgera gold output falls in first half and qtr.
newsitem.headline: Porgera gold output falls in first half and qtr.

text.p: Operator Placer Pacific Ltd said six month output at the Porgera gold mine joint venture in the highlands of Papua New Guinea fell to 383,976 ounces from 390,754 ounces a year earlier.
The company, a unit of Canada's Placer Dome Inc, said production in the second quarter ended June 30 fell to 151,812 ounces from 188,877 a year ago.
Porgera's cash operating cost per ounce during the June quarter was A$236 compared with A$323 a year earlier.
Underground output declined in the second quarter as expected to 114,758 tonnes of ore at 16.4 g/t from 171,938 tonnes a year ago, with the operation moving to full open pit production.
The open pit produced 1.463 million tonnes of ore at 4.4 g/t in the latest quarter.

While the water shortfall which temporarily stopped milling in the quarter was now over, management would continue to monitor water supplies in the September quarter as this was traditionally the driest time of year.
Placer Dome has a 50 percent stake in the project, while Goldfields Ltd and Orogen Minerals Ltd each hold 25 percent. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
